result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason J Weipert

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason J Weipert not in court.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jason J Weipert.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Warrant authorized on State's motion.

Defendant Jason J Weipert not in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jason J Weipert. Attorney Mickelson has been in contact with defendant. Defendant lives in Dubuque and was looking for gas money. State's offer required payment of restitution but case will be resolved with or without payment. State heard. Court continues status with same trial weeks.
Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Jason J Weipert in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ian Mickelson in court for Jason J Weipert. Waiver has been filed. Court reviews waiver and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court binds matter over for trial. Information filed. Defendant waives reading and pleads not guilty to charge. Status date set.
Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status conference on June 20, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jason J Weipert in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. Defendant can not afford to hire an attorney. Defendant has been in contact with SPD. State requests signature bond. Court heard and orders $300 signature bond. Defendant is to go to SPD now to see if he qualifies and to return back to court. Defendant back from SPD and does qualify. Court finds good cause to waive preliminary hearing time limits. Status as to counsel set.
